title: Coin flipping
text: First load required R packages:

title: Coin flipping
text: coin model one basic models TreePPL model library. can find available models information . want look TreePPL code R, can use following functions: main part model defined function called coinModel: definition function preceded keywords model function. model scripts must exactly one model function. model function takes input argument(s) observed data wish condition . case, data represented sequence (vector array) Boolean (TRUE/FALSE) values. Note TreePPL uses type annotation input variables form <argument_name>: <data_type>. square brackets [] used denote sequence type, , coinflips: Bool[] tells us model function takes single argument name coinflips, data type sequence Booleans. return type function specified using format => <data_type>. model function returns value p. general, model function return model parameters interested inferring posterior distribution. model function starts statements commented // put front . code lines can used print value coinflips argument. statement assume p ~ Beta(2.0,2.0) specifies prior probability distribution parameter p model. TreePPL provides number built-probability distributions; names starting capital letter, like Beta distribution used . assume statement followed loop input data sequence, conditioning simulation observed value (heads/TRUE tails/FALSE). Specifically, achieved calling help function flip. flip function defined follows: Bernoulli probability distribution binary outcome space, represented Boolean variable taking values TRUE FALSE. appropriate probability distribution coin flipping. single parameter Bernoulli distribution, called probability flip function, assumed convention probability obtaining outcome TRUE. case, probability obtaining heads. observe statement weights simulation likelihood observing particlar data point Bernoulli distribution. completes TreePPL description coin flipping model. TreePPL model descriptions essentially follow format. complete coverage TreePPL language, see language overview TreePPL online documentation.
code: model_path <- tp_model("coin") readr::read_file(model_path) model function coinModel(coinflips: Bool[]) => Real  {   // Uncomment if you want to test the input   //printLn("Input:");   //let coinStr = apply(bool2string, coinflips);   //printLn(join(coinStr));   assume p ~ Beta(2.0, 2.0); // prior   let n = length(coinflips);   for i in 1 to n {     flip(coinflips[i], p); // likelihood   }   return(p); // posterior } function flip(datapoint: Bool, probability: Real) {   observe datapoint ~ Bernoulli(probability); }

title: Coin flipping
text: TreePPL offers variety inference methods. Different methods work best different models. , use sequential Monte Carlo (SMC), specifically bootstrap particle filter version (method=smc-bpf option). function tp_compile() many optional arguments allow select among inference methods supported TreePPL, setting relevant options one . --date description available inference strategies supported, see tp_compile_options(). Now let’s compile model en executable also contains necessary machinery run chosen inference method.

title: Coin flipping
text: Now can start analyzing model inferring value p given observed sequence coin flips. , need provide observations suitable format. load example data provided treepplr package, use: can look structure input data using: TreePPL compiler requires data JSON format. conversion R variables appropriate JSON code understood TreePPL done automatically treepplr supported data types. instance, logical vectors R converted sequences Booleans (Bool[]) TreePPL. R, data collected list. element list named using corresponding argument name expected TreePPL model function. arguments can given order list. case, model function takes one argument called coinflips, R list contains one element named coinflips.
code: data <- tp_data(data_input = "coin") jsonlite::fromJSON(data) $coinflips  [1]  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  TRUE  TRUE FALSE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE  TRUE FALSE FALSE

title: Coin flipping
text: Now can run TreePPL program, inferring posterior distribution p conditioned input data. done using tp_run function. Let’s run 10 sweeps (10 SMC runs, wish). run take seconds complete depending machine. general, TreePPL inference strategies can described nested approaches outermost shell defines character inference output. outer shell SMC, case , returned object nested R list. entry outermost list layer correspond sweep. sweep contain three values: normalizing constant estimated sweep, returned values model function (one returned value SMC particle), likelihood weight returned value (one weight particle).
code: output_list <- tp_run(compiled_model = exe_path, data = data, n_sweeps = 10)

title: Coin flipping
text: SMC can assess quality inference running several sweeps comparing normalizing constants test generated similar estimates posterior distribution. popular argument SMC literature suggests SMC estimate accurate variance estimates normalizing constant across sweeps lower 1. check variance normalizing constant, use tp_smc_convergence() function. first, ’ll use tp_parse_smc() function convert results returned TreePPL R data frame appropriately weighted values, taking particle weights normalizing constants (sweep weights, wish) account. Note particle weights normalizing constants given log units. seems run provides quite accurate estimate posterior distribution, variance much smaller 1.0. also easy plot sampled values.
code: output <- tp_parse_smc(output_list)  tp_smc_convergence(output) #> [1] 0.000693138 ggplot2::ggplot(output, ggplot2::aes(samples, weight = norm_weight)) +   ggplot2::geom_histogram(ggplot2::aes(y = ggplot2::after_stat(density)),                  col = "white", fill = "lightblue", binwidth=0.01) +   ggplot2::geom_density() +   ggplot2::theme_bw()

title: Quick package overview
text: can choose model TreePPL language library can write model. list available models library, use tp_model_library() retrieve models within TreePPL github repository. use one models just need ’s name model_lib$model_name. want use custom model, need write TreePPL language pass R object contains either full path .tppl file containing model, string full model.
code: model_lib <- tp_model_library() # import a model from file model_path <- "path/to/my_model.tppl"

title: Quick package overview
text: TreePPL reads custom JSON format, treepplr converts variety input data format writes file, used TreePPL. examples: models, can also use test datasets TreePPL library passing name model (’ll come back later).
code: # for models that only need a phylogenetic tree phylo <- ape::read.tree(file = "path/to/your/file.tre") data_path <- tp_data(data_input = phylo)  # or sequence data fasta_file <- "path/to/your/file.fasta" data_path <- tp_data(data_input = fasta_file)

title: Quick package overview
text: TreePPL offers variety inference methods. Different methods work best different models. See model library recommendations inference methods choose model.

title: Quick package overview
text: chosen model inference method want use, can compile model en executable also contains necessary machinery run chosen inference method.
code: # Using a model from the library and a Sequential Monte Carlo method exe_path <- tp_compile(model = "crbd", method = "smc-apf", particles = 10000)  # Using a custom model and a Markov chain Monte Carlo method exe_path <- tp_compile(model = model_path, method = "mcmc-lightweight",                        iterations = 10000)

title: Quick package overview
text: Now ready run analysis. pass data compiled executable choose many independent runs want .
code: output <- tp_run(compiled_model = exe_path, data = data_path, n_runs = 4)

title: Quick package overview
text: can parse output produce data frame check convergence.
code: # If using SMC output_df_smc <- tp_parse_smc(output)  tp_smc_convergence(output_df_smc) # If using MCMC output_df_mcmc <- tp_parse_mcmc(output)

title: Quick package overview
text: Different models produce different outputs thus require different post-processing. See model-specific tutorials ways process TreePPL output.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Mariana P Braga. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: P Braga M (2026). treepplr: R Interface TreePPL. R package version 0.11.0, https://github.com/treeppl/treepplr.
code: @Manual{,   title = {treepplr: R Interface to TreePPL},   author = {Mariana {P Braga}},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.11.0},   url = {https://github.com/treeppl/treepplr}, }

title: R Interface to TreePPL
text: treepplr R Interface TreePPL, probabilistic programming language phylogenetics. treepplr converts data format readable TreePPL, reads TreePPL output, connects downstream analyses model-specific packages, evolnets package host repertoire evolution model. See package’s documentation . find package functions Reference, basic examples running various models Articles.

title: R Interface to TreePPL
text: can install treepplr like : install R package. TreePPL compiler downloaded installed run first analysis, TreePPL compiler called. download, see message like subsequent analyses, TreePPL compiler called directly, skipping step.
code: if(!require("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) {   install.packages("devtools")   library(devtools) } else {  library(devtools) }  devtools::install_github("treeppl/treepplr") [xx%] Downloaded xxxxxx bytes...

what: Compile a TreePPL model and create inference machinery — tp_compile
title: Compile a TreePPL model and create inference machinery — tp_compile
text: tp_compile compile TreePPL model create inference machinery used tp_run.

title: Compile a TreePPL model and create inference machinery — tp_compile
code: tp_compile(   model,   method,   iterations = NULL,   particles = NULL,   dir = NULL,   output = NULL,   ... )

title: Compile a TreePPL model and create inference machinery — tp_compile
text: model One tree options: full path model file contains TreePPL code, string name model supported treepplr (see tp_model_library()), string containing entire TreePPL code. method Inference method used. See tp_compile_options() supported methods. iterations number MCMC iterations run. particles number SMC particles run. dir directory want save executable. Default base::tempdir() output Complete path compiled TreePPL program created. Default dir/.exe ... See tp_compile_options() supported arguments.

title: Compile a TreePPL model and create inference machinery — tp_compile
text: path compiled TreePPL program.

title: Import data for TreePPL program — tp_data
Import data for TreePPL program — tp_data
text: data_input One following options: named list (structured list) containing TreePPL data, full path multiple sequence alignment fasta (.fasta, .fas) nexus (.nexus, .nex) format, test data, string name model supported treepplr (see tp_model_library()). data_file_name optional name file created. Ignored data_input name model TreePPL library. dir directory want save data file JSON format. Default base::tempdir(). Ignored data_input name model TreePPL library.

title: Import data for TreePPL program — tp_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Example using a model name supported by TreePPL input <- tp_data("tree_inference") input  # Example using an internal FASTA file (same input data as before, but in fasta format) fasta_file <- system.file("extdata", "tree_inference.fasta", package = "treepplr") input <- tp_data(fasta_file) input } # }

title: Convert phylo obj to TreePPL tree — tp_phylo_to_tpjson
Convert phylo obj to TreePPL tree — tp_phylo_to_tpjson
text: phylo_tree object class ape::phylo. age string determines way age nodes calculated (default "branch-length"). "branch-length" : Root's age = NA, branch-length parent branch "root--tip" : Root's age = 0.0, cumulative branch-length root "tip--root" : Leaf's age = 0.0, cumulative branch-length leaf

title: Run a TreePPL program — tp_run
text: Run TreePPL return output.

title: Run a TreePPL program — tp_run
code: tp_run(   compiled_model,   data,   n_runs = NULL,   n_sweeps = NULL,   dir = NULL,   out_file_name = "out",   ... )

title: Run a TreePPL program — tp_run
text: compiled_model base::character full path compiled model outputted tp_compile. data base::character full path data file TreePPL JSON format (outputted tp_data). n_runs using MCMC, base::integer giving number runs done. n_sweeps using SMC, base::integer giving number SMC sweeps done. dir base::character full path directory want save output. Default base::tempdir(). out_file_name base::character name output file JSON format. Default "". ... See tp_run_options supported arguments.

title: Run a TreePPL program — tp_run
text: list TreePPL output parsed JSON format.

title: Run a TreePPL program — tp_run
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # When using SMC # compile model and create SMC inference machinery exe_path <- tp_compile(model = "coin", method = "smc-bpf", particles = 2000)  # prepare data data_path <- tp_data(data_input = "coin")  # run TreePPL result <- tp_run(exe_path, data_path, n_sweeps = 2)   # When using MCMC # compile model and create MCMC inference machinery exe_path <- tp_compile(model = "coin", method = "mcmc-naive", iterations = 2000)  # prepare data data_path <- tp_data(data_input = "coin")  # run TreePPL result <- tp_run(exe_path, data_path, n_runs = 2) } # }
